mortality.note: Estimates range from 200k to 2M killed. 14-18 million displaced - largest mass migration in history. Violence was multi-directional across religious lines.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Hasty British withdrawal, communal violence, forced migrations. State collapse.
rationales.profit: Not profit-driven. Chaotic violence over religious identity and territory.
rationales.ideology: Hindu-Muslim communalism exploited by politicians. Two-nation theory.
rationales.complicity: British rushed partition. Political leaders inflamed tensions. Communities turned on neighbors.

analysis.pattern_note: Rushed British withdrawal (Mountbatten moved date up by 10 months) left no time for orderly transition. Radcliffe Line drawn in 6 weeks by lawyer who'd never been to India. Violence was communal and chaotic rather than state-directed. Legacy: Kashmir conflict, 3 India-Pakistan wars, ongoing nuclear tensions.
analysis.root_causes: British divide-and-rule legacy, communalism, rushed partition, weak transitional authority

sources.title: Midnight's Furies: The Deadly Legacy of India's Partition
sources.author: Nisid Hajari
